illusion.translation[0].definitions[0].d: an idea or opinion that is wrong, especially about yourself
illusion.translation[0].definitions[0].e: She was under no illusion that he loved her.
It is an illusion that the Arctic is dark in winter.
She had no illusions about her physical attractiveness.
‘I hate to shatter your illusions, ’ he said.
They suffer from the illusion that they cannot solve their problems.
illusion.translation[0].definitions[1].d: something that seems to be different from the way it really is
illusion.translation[0].definitions[1].e: Credit creates the illusion that you can own things without paying for them.
The mirrors in the room gave an illusion of greater space.
He was unlikely to be satisfied with the illusion of power.
